contents:
The number of obese children ages 6 and over has increased by 400% in the last 25 years. Childhood obesity is a serious condition that continues into adulthood. The health risks of childhood obesity include:

• Hypertension, or high blood pressure

• Type 2 diabetes, the failure of the body to process sugar properly

• Damage to cartilage in the lower limbs and joints

• Sleep apnea, or breathing problems during sleep

• Depression

• Asthma
